get.description:
Configure and manage L2 VLAN profiles.
Each VLAN profile maps to each layer2 VLAN ID.
Using this profile features related to layer 2 VLAN can be configured like wired AAA profile for VLANs.
VLANs are primarily used to provide network segmentation at layer 2.
VLANs enable the grouping of users by logical function instead of physical location.
VLANs are generally assigned on an organizational basis rather than on a physical basis.

For example, a network administrator could assign all workstations and servers used by a particular workgroup to the same VLAN, regardless of their physical locations.
Hosts in the same VLAN can directly communicate with one another. A router or a Layer 3 switch is required for hosts in different VLANs to communicate with one another.
VLANs help reduce bandwidth waste, improve LAN security, and enable network administrators to address issues such as scalability and network management.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaVlan_Layer2VlanSchema.description:
Configure and manage L2 VLAN profiles.
Each VLAN profile maps to each layer2 VLAN ID.
Using this profile features related to layer 2 VLAN can be configured like wired AAA profile for VLANs.
VLANs are primarily used to provide network segmentation at layer 2.
VLANs enable the grouping of users by logical function instead of physical location.
VLANs are generally assigned on an organizational basis rather than on a physical basis.

For example, a network administrator could assign all workstations and servers used by a particular workgroup to the same VLAN, regardless of their physical locations.
Hosts in the same VLAN can directly communicate with one another. A router or a Layer 3 switch is required for hosts in different VLANs to communicate with one another.
VLANs help reduce bandwidth waste, improve LAN security, and enable network administrators to address issues such as scalability and network management.

vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

description-alias.description:
Description alias of the VLAN profile.;
Limit on description length for AP,GW:32 and for CX:64 characters.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf.description: Configure a VRF to be used for Distributed Firewall Policy for CX platforms.

qinq-svlan.description: Set the current VLAN as QinQ svlan

voice-enable-alias.description:
Alias to manage vlan voice enable/disable.
voice-enable-alias and voice-enable both cannot be set.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN

description-alias.description:
Description alias of the VLAN profile.;
Limit on description length for AP,GW:32 and for CX:64 characters.

vrf.x-typeDescription: Type definition for 'name', should be alphanumeric. Special characters such as '\', '/' and space are not allowed.
vrf.description: Configure a VRF to be used for Distributed Firewall Policy for CX platforms.

qinq-svlan.description: Set the current VLAN as QinQ svlan

voice-enable-alias.description:
Alias to manage vlan voice enable/disable.
voice-enable-alias and voice-enable both cannot be set.

x-enumDescriptions.PRIMARY:
Primary VLAN in private VLAN. There can be multiple secondary VLANs
associated with a primary VLAN. A primary VLAN and the associated
secondary VLANs together are called a private VLAN domain. The hosts
in secondary VLAN uses the primary VLAN to communicate with hosts
outside the PVLAN domain. Secondary VLANs can be of type either
ISOLATED or COMMUNITY.
x-enumDescriptions.ISOLATED:
Isolated VLAN in private VLAN. Hosts in isolated VLAN cannot
communicate with each other through layer 2 switching.
x-enumDescriptions.COMMUNITY:
Community VLAN in private VLAN. Hosts in a given community VLAN can
communicate with each other through Layer 2 switching. There can be
multiple community VLANs associated to a primary VLAN.

private-vlan-type.description:
Type of private VLAN.For AOS-CX, it can be PRIMARY, ISOLATED, or COMMUNITY.
 If the value is ISOLATED or COMMUNITY then private-vlan-association  also
 should be configured to indicate the primary VLAN to which the ISOLATED/COMMUNITY
 VLAN is associated. For PVOS(AOS-S),only PRIMARY is valid. The isolated-vlan and
 community-vlan parameters can be used to configure the secondary VLANs.
 Private VLAN and QinQ are mutually exclusive.

private-vlan-association.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
private-vlan-association.description: Associating a secondary VLAN of private-vlan-type COMMUNITY or ISOLATED to a primary VLAN

isolated-vlan.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
isolated-vlan.description: Configure an isolated VLAN under the current primary VLAN.

items.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
items.description: Configure a list of community VLANs under the current primary VLAN.

ArubaVlanCommon_ArpInspectionVlan.description: Dynamic ARP Inspection VLAN prameter grouping

enable.description: Enable status of Dynamic ARP Inspection on the VLAN

option-82.description: To control DHCPv4 Option 82. This is related to DHCP-Relay module.

is-l3-vlan.description: is this vlan an l3 vlan, used only for GET calls

x-enumDescriptions.NETBEUI:
Network Basic Input/Output Stream (BIOS)
Enhanced User Interface Protocol Group

items.description: Assign traffic to different VLANs based on protocol.

description.description:
Description of the VLAN profile.;
Limit on description length for AP,GW:32 and for CX:64 characters.

ttl-threshold.description:
Multicast datagram TTL threshold for the
VLAN.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

An IPv6 address represented as either a full address; shortened
or mixed-shortened formats, using the default zone.

ArubaMgmd_MgmdVlanCommonConfig.description: Grouping for common MGMD Configurations on the VLAN

items.description: This list is now deprecated. The list of eth-interfaces on which IGMP/MLD fastleave is configured.
This list is now deprecated. The list of eth-interfaces on which IGMP/MLD forced fastleave is configured.
This list is now deprecated. Configure the eth-interface to monitor traffic on specific ports.
This list is now deprecated. Configure the eth-interface in block mode for IGMP/MLD.
This list is now deprecated. Configure the eth-interfaces in forward mode for IGMP/MLD.

querier-enable.description: This leaf is now deprecated.Enable IGMP/MLD Querier on this device.

last-member-query-interval.description:
This leaf is now deprecated. The number of seconds between successive group-specific
query messages.

robustness.description: This leaf is now deprecated.Set the number of times to retry a IGMP/MLD query.

query-max-response-time.description:
This leaf is now deprecated.The number of seconds to wait for a response to an
IGMP/MLD query.

policy-in.description:
Ingress ACL to filter processing of IGMP reports
and leave messages received

preprogram-starg-flow.description:
Enable pre-programming of summarized multicast
flows in the forwarding table on receiving IGMP
join

ArubaMgmd_IgmpVlanConfig.description: Grouping for IGMP Configurations on the VLAN

snooping.description: Enable IGMP snooping on the VLAN.

enable.description: This leaf is now deprecated.Enable IGMP on the VLAN

version.description: The IGMP protocol version to use.

strict-version.description: Process only the selected IGMP version packets.

filter-unknown-multicast.description: This leaf is now deprecated.Block Flooding of IPv4 Unknown Multicast Packets

query-interval.description: This leaf is now deprecated.Sets the interval in seconds between IGMP queries.

ArubaMgmd_MldVlanConfig.description: Grouping for MLD Configurations on the VLAN

snooping.description: Enable MLD snooping on the VLAN.

enable.description: This leaf is now deprecated.Enable MLD on the VLAN

version.description: The MLD protocol version to use.

strict-version.description: Process only the selected MLD version packets.

query-interval.description: This leaf is now deprecated.Sets the interval in seconds between MLD queries.

ArubaClientIptracker_VlanConfig.description: Grouping for VLAN-level configuration parameters of client IP tracker.

client-ip-tracker-enable.description: Enable client IP tracking on this VLAN.  This is applicable to AOS-CX Switch.

enable.description: Enable status of DHCPv4-Snooping on the VLAN

ip-binding-enable.description: Learn DHCPv4-Snooping IP bindings on the VLAN

enable.description: Enable status of DHCPv6-Snooping on the VLAN

allow-bindings-on-trusted-ports.description: Allow learning bindings on trusted ports

ip-binding-enable.description: Learn DHCPv6-Snooping IP bindings on the VLAN

allow-bindings-on-trusted-ports.description: Allow learning ND-Snoop bindings on trusted ports

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).

ArubaDestinationGuard_DestinationGuardVl.description: IPv6 destination guard VLAN parameter grouping

destination-guard.description:
IPv6 destination guard VLAN prameters.
Enabling IPv6 Destination Guard on a switch prevents ND Cache depletion
issues and it helps in minimizing Denial-Of-Service(DoS) attacks. When
IPv6 destination guard is enabled address resolution is performed only
for the destination addresses that are active on the link.

enable.description: Enable IPv6 destination guard on the VLAN
